item.title: A Baldurâ€™s Gate TV Show Is Happening In The Worst Way Possible
item.content:encoded:
Three days ago, I was talking about how sometimes good things happen, like HBOâ€™s bunk-ass live-action The Last of Us series looking likely to end in three seasons rather than four. Well, the monkeyâ€™s paw didnâ€™t just curl, it rolled in upon itself with an intensity great enough to open a portal to a much, much worse dimension. Craig Mazin, whio serves as showrunner on the post-apocalyptic adaptation, isnâ€™t done at HBO; heâ€™s now apparently working on a Baldurâ€™s Gate series that will continue the story of Larian Studiosâ€™ RPG. Just shoot me, HBO.

Deadline reports that Mazin is working alongside Hasbro to create a continuation of the Baldurâ€™s Gate 3 story that will include both new characters and some returning ones from the game. You know, the ones whose fates you could have greatly influenced with your decisions in ways too drastic for the writers to have any wiggle room in making sweeping choices for them? I already donâ€™t trust Mazin with characters when heâ€™s following the source materialâ€™s script, much less continuing their stories beyond the credits. According to Deadlineâ€˜s story, Mazin has full creative control. Call me Gale Dekarios of Waterdeep the way I could explode right now.

â€œAfter putting nearly 1000 hours into the incredible world of Baldurâ€™s Gate 3, it is a dream come true to be able to continue the story that Larian and Wizards of The Coast created,â€ Mazin said in a statement to Deadline. â€œI am a devoted fan of D&D and the brilliant way that Swen Vincke and his gifted team adapted it. I canâ€™t wait to help bring Baldurâ€™s Gate and all of its incredible characters to life with as much respect and love as we can, and Iâ€™m deeply grateful to Gabe Marano and his team at Hasbro for entrusting me with this incredibly important property.â€

Thanks, I hate it. And Iâ€™ll inevitably be putting my boxing gloves on once more to enter the ring when it comes out like I did for The Last of Us.



https://kotaku.com/baldurs-gate-3-hbo-show-craig-mazin-last-of-us-2000666189

item.title: Overwatchâ€™s New Jetpack-Using Cat Hero Is An Agent Of Pure Chaos
item.content:encoded:
I do not fear many things in Overwatch, but I am beginning to fear Jetpack Cat. The flying feline hero is exactly what she sounds like, a cat that has endless flight and zooms around the map healing allies and pestering foes. However, she also has the ability to tether her teammates to her craft and fly them around the battlefield. The strategies and combos players have already found in just a brief early access period are incredibly chaotic.

I played a little bit of Jetpack Cat myself when I tried my hand at all five of Overwatchâ€™s new heroes last month, and while I donâ€™t think she will be joining my support hero rotation anytime soon, Iâ€™m already anticipating the ridiculous plays teams will pull off with her if theyâ€™re coordinating. The catâ€™s tether requires a teammate to opt in, meaning you donâ€™t have to worry about any Lifeweaver-style trolling or accidentally latching onto her and being taken for a ride. 

Once youâ€™re tethered, Jetpack Cat can fly you anywhere, as long as you donâ€™t get shot down by the enemy team. But her tether isnâ€™t limited to just teammates, it can also pick up things like Asheâ€™s Omnic ultimate B.O.B. as he fires down on the unsuspecting foes below, or D.Vaâ€™s mech suit after sheâ€™s set it to self destruct. This way you have a brief window to fix a bad play or placement. Meanwhile, Jetpack Catâ€™s ultimate lets her tether onto an enemy and drag them off the map or out of a fortified area, so youâ€™re not just restricted to picking up friendlies. Thereâ€™s a lot of potential and not a ton of limitations. Some early players have used dueling Jetpack Cats to pit two of their respective teammates against each other in an airborne battle.

item.title: PC Gaming Graphics Cards Are Basically A Rounding Error For Nvidia And Itâ€™s Acting Like It
item.content:encoded:
Nvidia is becoming that old friend who refuses to break it off but has clearly moved on. Nioh 3â€˜s devs donâ€™t believe in adding an easy mode. And Iâ€™m not shocked but I am still disappointed that Oblivion Remastered isnâ€™t even getting a game key card for its Switch 2 release. Itâ€™s the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotakuâ€˜s daily roundup of gaming news, rumors, and culture. Iâ€™m closely and cautiously monitoring the Xenoblade Chronicles 4 gossip in hopes it might secretly end up being one of Nintendoâ€™s big fall games for this year. That feels slightly ahead of schedule but a boy can dream.

Nvidia isnâ€™t denying reports that its GeForce graphics card plans have slowed

The Information reports that the tech company at the epicenter of AI market shockwaves is scaling back producing of its 50-series graphics cards and delaying a mid-gen refresh of its Blackwell designs. Hardware leaker Kopite7kimi is claiming that a new 6090 batch of cards wonâ€™t appear until late 2027. And Nvidia isnâ€™t pumping the brakes on all of this speculative doom and gloom.

â€œDemand for GeForce RTX GPUs is strong, and memory supply is constrained,â€ it told IGN in a new statement. â€œWe continue to ship all GeForce SKUs and are working closely with our suppliers to maximize memory availability.â€ I feel better already! Donâ€™t you?

But honestly, pulling back on PC gaming is exactly what every market signal is telling Nvidia to do at the moment. Itâ€™s quarterly revenue in 2014 was $1.23 billion. That set a record at the time. Last quarter it earned $4.3 billion from PC gaming alone, but gaming revenue was a much smaller proportion of the companyâ€™s business overall. Total revenue was over $50 billion, setting an all new record in which PC gaming accounted for just 8 percent.

In the meantime, Nvidia just agreed to dump $20 billion into OpenAI after originally promising up to $100 billion. That might seem like itâ€™s hedging its bets, but $20 billion is still more than all the money the company will earn from its PC gaming business in the next year.

Ubisoft devs grill management on the publisherâ€™s missteps

A townhall Q&A with CEO Yves Guillemot and others to re-instill confidence in the rank-and-file did anything but, according to Insider Gaming. The leadership team remained adamantly opposed to altering the companyâ€™s controversial new RTO policy and defended it by pointing to similar policies at competitors like Riot Games, Activision Blizzard, and Rockstar Games. What about more mass layoffs? In response to a question about cuts of over 2,000 employees, CFO Frederik Duguet was less than reassuring. â€œFirst of all, we must state very clearly that we have never shared such numbers externally, and as Iâ€™ve just said, we wonâ€™t share any more decisions today,â€ he reportedly told the group.

Square Enix has big FF7 plans for 2026

â€œThis year, we plan to share more updates on the Final Fantasy VII Remake Project than ever before,â€ director Naoki Hamaguchi shared on Thursday after it was confirmed that Rebirth is coming to both Switch 2 and Xbox on June 3. Does that mean weâ€™ll finally get the third part of the trilogy before the end of 2026? Or is this just the marketing machine ramping up for an early 2027 launch? It probably depends on Grand Theft Auto 6, as every other release date will this year.

Borderlands 4â€˜s newest content arrives later this month

Bounty Pack 2: Legend of the Stone Demon will go live on February 26, Gearbox Entertainment confirmed on Thursday. It will be â€œbite-sized-yet-flavorful narrative contentâ€ alongside free updates like the addition of Pearlescent gear. The next batch of main story missions, meanwhile, is called Mad Ellie and the Vault of the Damned and theyâ€™re coming in March along with a new vault hunter, the ex-casino bot C4SH.

Hideo Kojima is back in the video editing bay

â€œEditing for the first time inâ€¦8 months?â€ he tweeted with a sad face. Could this be for the rumored PlayStation State of Play taking place later this month? Current guesses are a PC port of Death Stranding 2 or a big DLC for it. Surely itâ€™s too early for anything else?

Nioh 3 will not be giving casual players a break anytime soon

â€œWeâ€™ve never considered adding difficulty settings to the Nioh series,â€ director Masaki Fujita told Eurogamer. â€œThe value of clearing the game is something that is unifying, and since Nioh 3 has even more variations on strategies to clear the game compared to previous games in the series, our approach is not to change the difficulty setting when you canâ€™t clear it.â€

Bethesda finds something Switch 2 players hate more than game key cards

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will come to Nintendoâ€™s portable console as a cartridge with the full game on it. Fallout 4 and Oblivion Remastered, however, will not. They wonâ€™t even be game key cards. Theyâ€™ll just be download codes in boxes. It sounds par for the course with how rough the ports look.

ICYMI:

  • The AI tech weirdos forced Valve to delay its Steam Machine
  • Everything coming to Overwatch in its biggest year ever
  • Fallout season 2 was fun to watch but terrible TV 

Watch this:

item.title: The Winter Olympics Will Make Sure Nobody Cheats By Injecting Their Penis With Acid
item.content:encoded:
Are male ski jumpers injecting a specific kind of acid into their penises in order to gain a small advantage over their competitors? Maybe. But if so, donâ€™t worry, Winter Olympics officials are on it.

As reported by the BBC, thereâ€™s been a strange rumor floating around menâ€™s ski jumping, and it all started after German newspaper Bild reported in January that some athletes were injecting hyaluronic acid into their penises before being measured by officials for their tight-fitting suits. Why? Apparently, the acid, which is not banned, causes the injected penis to grow in circumference by about one to two centimeters, or a little less than an inch. In theory, this would increase the surface area of the ski suit during jumps, which could possibly increase how far a skier flies and help them eke out a win.

â€œEvery extra centimetre on a suit counts. If your suit has a 5 percent bigger surface area, you fly further,â€ ski jumping menâ€™s race director Sandro Pertile told the BBC. Before the start of a season, ski jumpers are 3D scanned and measured to create skin-tight suits. Part of the measuring process includes the amount of fabric around the crotch. So a bit more girth could provide a little more fabric, and that could equal a slightly longer jump.

Thereâ€™s just one problem with this wild theory: There is no evidence that itâ€™s happening at the Winter Olympics.

International Ski and Snowboard Federation (FIS) communications director Bruno Sassi told the BBC that there has â€œnever been any indicationâ€ nor â€œevidenceâ€ that a male skier has injected hyaluronic acid into their penis to gain an unfair advantage. Though it is also possible that this is happening, and nobody has been caught yet.

â€œI am not aware of the details of ski jumping, and how that could improve performance,â€ World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) director Olivier Niggli said when asked about the penis injection claims during a recent Winter Olympics press conference. â€œIf anything was to come to the surface, we would look at it and see if it is doping-related. We donâ€™t address other [non-doping] means of enhancing performance.â€

WADAâ€™s Polish president Witold Banka added: â€œSki jumping is very popular in Poland, so I promise you Iâ€™m going to look at it.â€

The Winter Olympics start on Friday in Italy. Menâ€™s ski jumping begins on Monday.



https://kotaku.com/winter-olympics-injecting-penis-acid-skiing-real-men-ski-jumping-cheating-2000666137

item.title: Overwatchâ€™s â€˜Same Face Syndromeâ€™ Has Claimed Another Victim
item.content:encoded:
Overwatchâ€™s character design has gotten a bit homogeneous over the years, and fans have taken notice of it. Specifically, the women of Blizzardâ€™s hero shooter have suffered from a bit of â€œsame face syndromeâ€ for years, with characters like Widowmaker, Ashe, and Freja being nearly identical in some skins. However, itâ€™s gotten especially bad for the gameâ€™s East Asian heroes since Kiriko came onto the scene in 2022. Now Anran, one of the new heroes joining the game next week, is the latest victim of this phenomenon.

Anran is a fire-wielding hero and the sister of the gameâ€™s water-bending support hero Wuyang. As such, she appeared in animated trailers, comics, and other lore before she was implemented into the game itself. Before her in-game appearance, she was depicted with a longer nose and sharper features, and overall had a distinct face compared to other characters on the roster. Now that weâ€™ve seen her in the game itself, however, fans have pointed out that her face is much more round and her nose has been shrunken down to the same button nose Kiriko and Juno have. 

the audible sigh I let out pic.twitter.com/0HYZoKjiB7

â€” Dahja ğŸ§ (@Dahja3D) February 4, 2026

The similarities are so striking that some fans are joking she looks like sheâ€™s an alternate skin for Kiriko. The comparison between Anranâ€™s old face and her new one is pretty stark, but seeing Kiriko or Junoâ€™s face next to her current appearance is when the issue really becomes apparent. She looks less like Wuyangâ€™s sister than she once did.

how do you have a team of artists and still end up with same face syndrome as bad as this . BROTHER. pic.twitter.com/8AK1m9I7D4

â€” â˜†Kiâ˜… (@foxkiez) February 4, 2026

rhinoplasty, eye lift, jaw shave, botox, cheek filler, facial bone surgery, gastric bypass surgery, face lift, lip filler, buccal fat removal pic.twitter.com/f4OAgIquGg

â€” Sasha ğŸ”¨ TorbjÃ¶rn CEO (@torbillionare) February 4, 2026

They rly messed up with Anran's face bc I got multiple languages on my feed upset about it

â€” Moira's Little Rabbitâ¸†â¸‰ (@MoirasLilRabbit) February 5, 2026

rewatched wuyangâ€™s cimematic and. who is this ??? #NOTMYANRAN #overwatch pic.twitter.com/YTx7GjL8Vu

â€” moss â‚Š âŠ¹ âœ§ (@staplesquid) February 4, 2026

"got your nose!" but it's anran's in-game model

â€” Wuyangful ğŸŒŠAzelf (@wuyangart) February 4, 2026

Fans have created some edits that try to recapture Anranâ€™s original look and they show how, with just a few tweaks, Anran can not only look like she once did, but can look pretty distinct in a game in which several characters look like each other.

just some changes i'd make going off how she looked in the animation https://t.co/cV61EIVvql pic.twitter.com/JpTyvcam2B

â€” ğŸŒ ramuğŸŒ ğŸ‰ (@ramunaeee) February 4, 2026

Anran is available to play today as an early trial character, so itâ€™s not like the Overwatch team has time to make any changes, despite fan reactions. She is one of five heroes joining the roster on February 10, alongside the beginning of the new season in which Overwatch 2 is dropping the 2 from its name.
